meanings.definition: In a sharp or sudden manner.
meanings.sent1: She turned around sharpish when she heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: He stopped sharpish when he saw the red light.
meanings.sent3: The cat jumped off the table sharpish when it saw a cucumber.
meanings.sent4: The car screeched to a halt sharpish as the deer ran across the road.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice rose sharpish as she reprimanded the noisy students.

meanings.sent1: The sharpish pencil tip broke when he pressed too hard.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a sharpish knife to slice the vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The sharpish thorn pricked his finger as he reached for the flower.
meanings.sent4: The sharpish edges of the rock made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent5: The sharpish corners of the box poked through the wrapping paper.

meanings.sent1: She replied sharpish to the urgent email.
meanings.sent2: He finished his homework sharpish before dinner.
meanings.sent3: The dog fetched the ball sharpish when it was thrown.
meanings.sent4: The waiter brought our food to the table sharpish.
meanings.sent5: The bus arrived sharpish just as we reached the bus stop.
